title: Did 'The Supremes' have any success after Diana Ross went solo? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mediocre. Up the Ladder to the Roof #10 (1970) Stoned Love #7 (1970) Nathan Jones #17 (1971) River Deep Mountain High (recorded with the 4 tops. A horrible song that nonetheless scratched the top 20 (1971). Floy Joy #16 (1972). I remembered that off the top of my head. Scary. They also had a big disco hit I'm Gonna Let My Heart Do the Walking (1976). It went top 10 disco and I believe top 50 pop charts....but even so by 1976 they were considered to be full-fledged has beens. The singer who replaced Diana Ross, Jean Terrell, had a beautiful voice, but she left when her four year contract expired out of frustration with Motown. And that's a pity. Motown squandered her talent.
Yes..They went on to have a reasonable recording career and very successful nightclub career. Their biggest hit after Diana Ross was probably Stoned Love.
